sentences.en: According to the calendar my birthday falls on a Sunday this year.
sentences.cn: 按照今年的日历,我的生日恰好是个星期日.

sentences.en: Franklin joined her and the children whenever his crowded calendar allowed.
sentences.cn: 只要能从百忙之中抽出空，富兰克林就会陪在妻儿身边。

sentences.en: He fastened the calendar to a wall.
He marked off the days on a calendar.
In the Chinese calendar, the Spring Equinox always occurs in the second month.
sentences.cn: 在中国历法中，春分总是出现在2月。

sentences.en: In the lunar calendar, the years are designated by the Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches.
It is one of the British sporting calendar's most prestigious events.
sentences.cn: 这是英国体坛大事表上最负盛名的赛事之一。

sentences.en: It is one of the classic events of the sporting calendar.
sentences.cn: 这是体育运动日程表中传统比赛项目之一.

sentences.en: It is, in fact, a primitive type of calendar.
sentences.cn: 事实上是一种最原始的日历.

sentences.en: The Christian calendar was originally based on the Julian calendar of the Romans.
sentences.cn: 公历最初是以罗马人的儒略历为基础制定的。

sentences.en: The presidential elections are the highlight of next year's political calendar.
sentences.cn: 总统选举是明年政治日程表上的大事.

sentences.en: There was a calendar on the wall above, with large squares around the dates.
sentences.cn: 墙的上方曾有一本日历，日期框在大方格里。

sentences.en: There was a calendar on the wall, with large squares around the dates.
sentences.cn: 墙上有一幅日历，每个日期都用大方框框着。

sentences.en: This field determines where to display the event on the calendar.
sentences.cn: 该字段决定了在日程表的什么地方显示事件。

sentences.en: Winners will be selected at the end of each calendar month.
sentences.cn: 每个月末都会选出优胜者。

words.tran_cn: 日历的；按日历的；历法的（等于calendrical）
日历的；历法的（calendar的形容词形式）

trans.tran_cn: 日历，历法，日程表，（一年之中的）重大事件（或重要日期）一览表
trans.tran_en: a set of pages that show the days, weeks, and months of a particular year, that you usually hang on a wall

trans.tran_cn: 将…列入表中；将…排入日程表
